author: zulutu
content: I've noticed some small dips in participation every so often from 96% -> 99%

author: zulutu
content: they only last an epoch or so

author: zulutu
content: https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/476588476393848832/786830940931358730/unknown.png

author: zulutu
content: I'm not sure if it's some operation restarting their nodes or something more interesting

author: ryg9705
content: Could be that epoch transition which is more resource intensive throws some weaker validators off.

author: zulutu
content: it's interesting because of how consistent it is

author: zulutu
content: I'll look into it over the weekend and report back

author: zulutu
content: zooming into one of these "dips" you can see issues voting on the correct head/target

author: zulutu
content: I don't think this is a _large_ operation taking their nodes offline

author: zulutu
content: I think I may have found an example: https://beaconcha.in/block/73816

author: zulutu
content: the epoch that this block is in has 96% participation, and this block only has 3 votes

author: zulutu
content: while all other blocks in this epoch have ~>1k votes

author: zulutu
content: given that there are 32 slots per epoch, one bad block could drop the participation by 1/32 ~= 3% we're seeing

author: ralexstokes
content: the theory being high propagation latency so that validators in that slot broadcast an attestation w the incorrect head, but ultimately the "late" block is included in the canonical chain

author: ralexstokes
content: this would explain the dip in "incorrect head" but does not explain the dip in "incorrect target"

author: ralexstokes
content: this particular block is 26/32 slots into the epoch so *should* be plenty of time for the boundary block to have propagated

author: zulutu
content: hmm. I'm not sure how this voting participation is calculated, but here's an example I found that correlates with ^

author: zulutu
content: https://beaconcha.in/block/63776

author: zulutu
content: the epoch for this block has 99%, but the next epoch has 96%. this is the last block in the epoch

author: zulutu
content: seeing the same thing on my graphs for this one - incorrect head and target votes
